dataIdInfo.idAbs: This ArcGIS Python tool exports ArcGIS feature classes in GeoJSON, CSV, shapefile (compressed and uncompressed) and KMZ to be published to the public as open data.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: David Walk, City of Philadelphia, Office of Technology, GIS Services Group

tool.name: Convert

param.name: in_features
param.dialogReference: The feature class that you want to export.

param.name: in_fields
param.dialogReference:
The fields that you want included in the exported files. You can rename fields in the second column.

Please note:

  • You should unchecked Object ID and SHAPE fields so that they will not be included in non-shapefile exports

  • X & Y coordinates are automatically included where necessary in file exports

param.name: output_dir
param.dialogReference: The directory path of the exported files

param.name: convert_4326
param.dialogReference: All open data must be converted to the spatial reference of WGS84. If your feature class is not already in WGS84, select this option.

param.name: convert_geojson
param.dialogReference:
Select this option to export your feature class to GeoJSON format.

GeoJSON is an open format for encoding collections of simple geographical features along with their non-spatial attributes using JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) that is often used in web maps.

param.name: convert_kmz
param.dialogReference:
Select this option to export your feature class to KMZ format.

KMZ files are the compressed Keyhole Markup Language (KML) file format, an XML notation for expressing geographic annotation and visualization within Internet-based, two-dimensional maps and three-dimensional browsers such as Google Earth.

param.name: convert_csv
param.dialogReference:
Select this option to export your feature class to CSV format.

The lattitude and longitude values of each feature of the selected feature class are included as columns in the CSV file. For this reason, a CSV file can only be exported for point features.

param.name: convert_metadata
param.dialogReference:
Select this option to export your feature class' metadata to Markdown format.

Markdown is a lightweight markup language for HTML that Github.com renders natively.

The output will be named README.md because GitHub.com renders this filename automatically in repos.

NOTE: You will probably have to format your data manually after export. This Markdown cheat sheet may help.

param.name: debug
param.dialogReference: Select this option to view all of the debug messages as the tool runs. This is only necessary if you are having a problem with the tool.

tool.summary: This ArcGIS Python tool exports ArcGIS feature classes in GeoJSON, CSV, shapefile (compressed and uncompressed) and KMZ to be published to the public as open data.
tool.usage: Select the options that you need the tool to perform to export the files that you need.
